channel.title: Help please
channel.description:
What part of CSS do you have to change to make the links in a table light up?
Such as on runelocus, or the little menu on the main page. http://www.moparisthebest.com, that when you hover over the link such as "forums" or "home" or "about me." Got the picture?
I'm new to web design, can any one help?

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @elflacodepr elflacodepr
item.description:
@elflacodepr wrote:

um, that will just made a underline on hover

yeah I’d know that i just gave an example…

Read full topic

Pwnd:

Errr, you might want to use the list item tags (

  • ) since you’re already using a set of unordered pair list tags.

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @wow_raped_XD wow_raped XD
item.description:
@wow_raped_XD wrote:

[quote=“elflacodepr, post:2, topic:219655”]ok you will do this

a:hover { text-decoration: underline; }

it can be changed to what ever you want, and as you state you are new to webdesign you can take a look at W3C Schools

hope that is what u need :)[/quote]

um, that will just made a underline on hover

put tis in head tags
try:

<script type="text/css">
#menu_1 {
width: auto;
height: auto;
background-color: #fff;
color: #000;
padding: 2px 2px 2px 2px;
}
#menu_1 a:hover {
background-color: #000;
color: #fff;
}
<script>

put tis in body
html:

<ul id="menu_1"><li>
<a href="#">Wow RLY??</a>
</li>
<li>
<ul id="menu_1">
<a href="#">Wow RLY??</a>
</li>
<li>
<ul id="menu_1">
<a href="#">Wow RLY??</a>
</il>
</ul>

edit background-color to your needs, and color is the text color btw.

Read full topic

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @elflacodepr elflacodepr
item.description:
@elflacodepr wrote:

ok you will do this

a:hover { text-decoration: underline; }

it can be changed to what ever you want, and as you state you are new to webdesign you can take a look at W3C Schools

hope that is what u need
